info.title: Infoblox DTC API
info.description: OpenAPI specification for Infoblox NIOS WAPI DTC objects

get.description: Returns a list of dtc objects matching the search criteria

get.description: Returns a list of dtc:record:naptr objects matching the search criteria

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: Comment for the record; maximum 256 characters.

parameters.name: dtc_server
parameters.description: The name of the DTC Server object with which the DTC record is associated.

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: The flags used to control the interpretation of the fields for an NAPTR record object. Supported values for the flags field are "U", "S", "P" and "A".

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The order parameter of the NAPTR records. This parameter specifies the order in which the NAPTR rules are applied when multiple rules are present. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 (inclusive), in 32-bit unsigned integer format.

parameters.name: preference
parameters.description: The preference of the NAPTR record. The preference field determines the order the NAPTR records are processed when multiple records with the same order parameter are present. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 (inclusive), in 32-bit unsigned integer format.

parameters.name: replacement
parameters.description: The replacement field of the NAPTR record object. For nonterminal NAPTR records, this field specifies the next domain name to look up. This value can be in unicode format.

parameters.name: services
parameters.description: The services field of the NAPTR record object; maximum 128 characters. The services field contains protocol and service identifiers, such as "http+E2U" or "SIPS+D2T".

get.description: Returns a specific dtc:record:naptr object by reference

put.description: Updates a specific dtc:record:naptr object by reference

delete.description: Deletes a specific dtc:record:naptr object by reference

get.description: Returns a list of dtc:record:srv objects matching the search criteria

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: Comment for the record; maximum 256 characters.

parameters.name: dtc_server
parameters.description: The name of the DTC Server object with which the DTC record is associated.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name for an SRV record in unicode format.

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: The port of the SRV record. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 (inclusive), in 32-bit unsigned integer format.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: The priority of the SRV record. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 (inclusive), in 32-bit unsigned integer format.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target of the SRV record in FQDN format. This value can be in unicode format.

parameters.name: weight
parameters.description: The weight of the SRV record. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 (inclusive), in 32-bit unsigned integer format.

get.description: Returns a specific dtc:record:srv object by reference

put.description: Updates a specific dtc:record:srv object by reference

delete.description: Deletes a specific dtc:record:srv object by reference

Returns a list of dtc:allrecords objects matching the search criteria

parameters.name: dtc_server
parameters.description: The name of the DTC Server object with which the record is associated.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The record type. When searching for an unspecified record type, the search is performed for all records. On retrieval, the appliance returns "UNSUPPORTED" for unsupported records.

put.description: Updates a specific dtc:allrecords object by reference

ReturnFields.name: _return_fields
ReturnFields.description: Enter the field names followed by comma

ReturnFieldsPlus.name: _return_fields+
ReturnFieldsPlus.description: Enter the field names followed by comma, this returns the required fields along with the default fields

MaxResults.name: _max_results
MaxResults.description: Enter the number of results to be fetched

ReturnAsObject.name: _return_as_object
ReturnAsObject.description: Select 1 if result is required as an object

PageId.name: _page_id
PageId.description: Page id for retrieving next page of results

Schema.name: _schema
Schema.description: Return schema for this object type

Inheritance.name: _inheritance
Inheritance.description: If this option is set to True, fields which support inheritance, will display data properly.

value.description: The value of the extensible attribute.

ExtAttrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object.

auto_create_host_record.description: Enabling this option will auto-create a single read-only A/AAAA/CNAME record corresponding to the configured hostname and update it if the hostname changes.

comment.description: Comment for the DTC Server; maximum 256 characters.

disable.description: Determines whether the DTC Server is disabled or not. When this is set to False, the fixed address is enabled.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

host.description: The address or FQDN of the server.

monitors.description: List of IP/FQDN and monitor pairs to be used for additional monitoring.

sni_hostname.description: The hostname for Server Name Indication (SNI) in FQDN format.

enabled_state.description: The enabled state of the object.

description.description: The textual description of the object's status.

host.description: IP address or FQDN of the server used for monitoring.

auto_consolidated_monitors.description: Flag for enabling auto managing DTC Consolidated Monitors in DTC Pool.

availability.description: A resource in the pool is available if ANY, at least QUORUM, or ALL monitors for the pool say that it is up.

comment.description: The comment for the DTC Pool; maximum 256 characters.

consolidated_monitors.description: List of monitors and associated members statuses of which are shared across members and consolidated in server availability determination.

disable.description: Determines whether the DTC Pool is disabled or not. When this is set to False, the fixed address is enabled.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

lb_alternate_method.description: The alternate load balancing method. Use this to select a method type from the pool if the preferred method does not return any results.

lb_alternate_topology.description: The alternate topology for load balancing.

lb_preferred_method.description: The preferred load balancing method. Use this to select a method type from the pool.

lb_preferred_topology.description: The preferred topology for load balancing.

quorum.description: For availability mode QUORUM, at least this many monitors must report the resource as up for it to be available

servers.description: The servers related to the pool.

ttl.description: The Time To Live (TTL) value for the DTC Pool. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the record is valid (cached). Zero indicates that the record should not be cached.

members.description: Members whose monitor statuses are shared across other members in a pool.

monitor.description: Monitor whose statuses are shared across other members in a pool.

availability.description: Servers assigned to a pool with monitor defined are healthy if ANY or ALL members report healthy status.

full_health_communication.description: Flag for switching health performing and sharing behavior to perform health checks on each DTC grid member that serves related LBDN(s) and send them across all DTC grid members from both selected and non-selected lists.

enabled_state.description: The enabled state of the object.

description.description: The textual description of the object's status.

method.description: The method of the DTC dynamic ratio load balancing.

monitor.description: The DTC monitor output of which will be used for dynamic ratio load balancing.

monitor_metric.description: The metric of the DTC SNMP monitor that will be used for dynamic weighing.

monitor_weighing.description: The DTC monitor weight. 'PRIORITY' means that all clients will be forwarded to the least loaded server. 'RATIO' means that distribution will be calculated based on dynamic weights.

invert_monitor_metric.description: Determines whether the inverted values of the DTC SNMP monitor metric will be used.

method.description: The method of the DTC dynamic ratio load balancing.

monitor.description: The DTC monitor output of which will be used for dynamic ratio load balancing.

monitor_metric.description: The metric of the DTC SNMP monitor that will be used for dynamic weighing.

monitor_weighing.description: The DTC monitor weight. 'PRIORITY' means that all clients will be forwarded to the least loaded server. 'RATIO' means that distribution will be calculated based on dynamic weights.

invert_monitor_metric.description: Determines whether the inverted values of the DTC SNMP monitor metric will be used.

auto_consolidated_monitors.description: Flag for enabling auto managing DTC Consolidated Monitors on related DTC Pools.

comment.description: Comment for the DTC LBDN; maximum 256 characters.

disable.description: Determines whether the DTC LBDN is disabled or not. When this is set to False, the fixed address is enabled.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

lb_method.description: The load balancing method. Used to select pool.

name.description: The display name of the DTC LBDN, not DNS related.

persistence.description: Maximum time, in seconds, for which client specific LBDN responses will be cached. Zero specifies no caching.

priority.description: The LBDN pattern match priority for "overlapping" DTC LBDN objects. LBDNs are "overlapping" if they are simultaneously assigned to a zone and have patterns that can match the same FQDN. The matching LBDN with highest priority (lowest ordinal) will be used.

topology.description: The topology rules for TOPOLOGY method.

ttl.description: The Time To Live (TTL) value for the DTC LBDN. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the record is valid (cached). Zero indicates that the record should not be cached.

types.description: The list of resource record types supported by LBDN.

enabled_state.description: The enabled state of the object.

description.description: The textual description of the object's status.

comment.description: Comment for this DTC monitor; maximum 256 characters.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

interval.description: The interval for a health check.

name.description: The display name for this DTC monitor.

retry_down.description: The number of how many times the server should appear as "DOWN" to be treated as dead after it was alive.

retry_up.description: The number of many times the server should appear as "UP" to be treated as alive after it was dead.

timeout.description: The timeout for a health check.

ciphers.description: An optional cipher list for a secure HTTP/S connection.

client_cert.description: An optional client certificate, supplied in a secure HTTP/S mode if present.

comment.description: Comment for this DTC monitor; maximum 256 characters.

content_check_input.description: A portion of response to use as input for content check.

content_check_op.description: A content check success criteria operator.

content_extract_group.description: A content extraction sub-expression to extract.

content_extract_type.description: A content extraction expected type for the extracted data.

content_extract_value.description: A content extraction value to compare with extracted result.

enable_sni.description: Determines whether the Server Name Indication (SNI) for HTTPS monitor is enabled.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

interval.description: The interval for TCP health check.

name.description: The display name for this DTC monitor.

result.description: The type of an expected result.

retry_down.description: The value of how many times the server should appear as down to be treated as dead after it was alive.

retry_up.description: The value of how many times the server should appear as up to be treated as alive after it was dead.

timeout.description: The timeout for TCP health check in seconds.

validate_cert.description: Determines whether the validation of the remote server's certificate is enabled.

comment.description: Comment for this DTC monitor; maximum 256 characters.

community.description: The SNMP community string for SNMP authentication.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

interval.description: The interval for TCP health check.

name.description: The display name for this DTC monitor.

oids.description: A list of OIDs for SNMP monitoring.

port.description: The port value for SNMP requests.

retry_down.description: The value of how many times the server should appear as down to be treated as dead after it was alive.

retry_up.description: The value of how many times the server should appear as up to be treated as alive after it was dead.

timeout.description: The timeout for TCP health check in seconds.

version.description: The SNMP protocol version for the SNMP health check.

oid.description: The SNMP OID value for DTC SNMP Monitor health checks.

comment.description: The comment for a DTC SNMP Health Monitor OID object.

type.description: The value of the condition type for DTC SNMP Monitor health check results.

condition.description: The condition of the validation result for an SNMP health check. The following conditions can be applied to the health check results: 'ANY' accepts any response; 'EXACT' accepts result equal to 'first'; 'LEQ' accepts result which is less than 'first'; 'GEQ' accepts result which is greater than 'first'; 'RANGE' accepts result value of which is between 'first' and 'last'.

first.description: The condition's first term to match against the SNMP health check result.

last.description: The condition's second term to match against the SNMP health check result with 'RANGE' condition.

comment.description: Comment for the record; maximum 256 characters.

disable.description: Determines if the record is disabled or not. False means that the record is enabled.

dtc_server.description: The name of the DTC Server object with which the DTC record is associated.

flags.description: The flags used to control the interpretation of the fields for an NAPTR record object. Supported values for the flags field are "U", "S", "P" and "A".

order.description: The order parameter of the NAPTR records. This parameter specifies the order in which the NAPTR rules are applied when multiple rules are present. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 (inclusive), in 32-bit unsigned integer format.

preference.description: The preference of the NAPTR record. The preference field determines the order the NAPTR records are processed when multiple records with the same order parameter are present. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 (inclusive), in 32-bit unsigned integer format.

regexp.description: The regular expression-based rewriting rule of the NAPTR record. This should be a POSIX compliant regular expression, including the substitution rule and flags. Refer to RFC 2915 for the field syntax details.

replacement.description: The replacement field of the NAPTR record object. For nonterminal NAPTR records, this field specifies the next domain name to look up. This value can be in unicode format.

services.description: The services field of the NAPTR record object; maximum 128 characters. The services field contains protocol and service identifiers, such as "http+E2U" or "SIPS+D2T".

dtc_server.description: The name of the DTC Server object with which the DTC record is associated.

name.description: The name for an SRV record in unicode format.

port.description: The port of the SRV record. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 (inclusive), in 32-bit unsigned integer format.

priority.description: The priority of the SRV record. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 (inclusive), in 32-bit unsigned integer format.

target.description: The target of the SRV record in FQDN format. This value can be in unicode format.

weight.description: The weight of the SRV record. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 (inclusive), in 32-bit unsigned integer format.

record.description: The record object, if supported by the WAPI. Otherwise, the value is "None".

ttl.description: The TTL value of the record associated with the DTC AllRecords object.

type.description: The record type. When searching for an unspecified record type, the search is performed for all records. On retrieval, the appliance returns "UNSUPPORTED" for unsupported records.

destination_link.description: The reference to the destination DTC pool or DTC server.

return_type.description: Type of the DNS response for rule.

sources.description: The conditions for matching sources. Should be empty to set rule as default destination.

topology.description: The DTC Topology the rule belongs to.

valid.description: True if the label in the rule exists in the current Topology DB. Always true for SUBNET rules. Rules with non-existent labels may be configured but will never match.

source_op.description: The operation used to match the value.
